abnormalities.Fasting Blood Glucose: Aapka fasting sugar level badha hua hai, jo diabetes ki taraf ishara karta hai.
abnormalities.HbA1c: Yeh test pichle 2-3 mahine ka average sugar level batata hai, aur yeh bhi high hai. Isse diabetes confirm hota hai.
abnormalities.Total Cholesterol: Aapke khoon mein total cholesterol ki matra zyada hai, jisse dil ki bimariyon ka khatra badh sakta hai.
abnormalities.LDL Cholesterol: Isko 'bad' cholesterol bhi kehte hain. Iska badha hua level aarteries (naso) mein blockage kar sakta hai.
abnormalities.Hemoglobin: Aapke khoon mein Hemoglobin kam hai, jise anemia (khoon ki kami) kehte hain. Isse thakawat aur kamzori ho sakti hai.

explanation: Aapki report ke anusaar, aapko teen mukhya samasyaayein hain: (1) High blood sugar, jo ki diabetes hai. (2) High cholesterol, jise dyslipidemia kehte hain, isse dil ke rog ka khatra badhta hai. (3) Hemoglobin ki kami, jise mild anemia kehte hain, isse kamzori mehsus ho sakti hai. Aapki kidney function normal hai. In sabhi cheezon ko control karne ke liye diet aur lifestyle mein badlav bahut zaroori hai.

day1.breakfast: 1 bowl vegetable dalia with a handful of almonds.
day1.lunch: 2 multigrain rotis, 1 katori mixed vegetable sabzi (gajar, beans, matar), 1 katori masoor dal, and a bowl of cucumber salad.
day1.dinner: 1 bowl of lauki (bottle gourd) soup, 1 small bowl of quinoa khichdi with vegetables.
day1.snacks: 1 apple and a glass of buttermilk (chhaas) in the evening.

day2.breakfast: 2 pieces of moong dal chilla with mint chutney.
day2.lunch: 1 bowl of brown rice, 1 katori palak paneer (low-fat paneer, less oil), 1 katori chana dal, and tomato-onion salad.
day2.dinner: 2 jowar rotis with 1 katori tori (ridge gourd) sabzi and a small bowl of curd.
day2.snacks: A bowl of mixed sprouts salad in the evening.

day3.breakfast: 1 bowl of oats upma with lots of vegetables.
day3.lunch: 2 ragi rotis, 1 katori methi aloo (less potato, more methi), 1 katori sambar, and a side of grated carrot salad.
day3.dinner: 1 bowl of mixed vegetable and lentil soup, with a small portion of roasted paneer tikka (homemade).
day3.snacks: A pear and a handful of roasted makhana.

day4.breakfast: 1 bowl of poha with peanuts and curry leaves, garnished with lemon.
day4.lunch: 2 bajra rotis, 1 katori beetroot sabzi (for iron), 1 katori urad dal, and a bowl of kachumber salad.
day4.dinner: 1 bowl of vegetable clear soup, followed by 1 bowl of paneer bhurji with 1 multigrain roti.
day4.snacks: A guava and a glass of unsweetened lassi.

day5.breakfast: 2 small besan (gram flour) theplas with a small bowl of low-fat curd.
day5.lunch: 1 bowl of vegetable pulao (made with brown rice), 1 katori kadhi (less oil), and a side of sprout salad.
day5.dinner: 2 small oats uttapam with mixed vegetable topping and a bowl of tomato rasam.
day5.snacks: A handful of walnuts and 2-3 dates (for iron).

day6.breakfast: Scrambled tofu (or paneer) with onions and tomatoes, with 1 slice of whole wheat toast.
day6.lunch: 2 jowar-wheat mix rotis, 1 katori bhindi (okra) sabzi, 1 katori arhar dal, and a bowl of green salad.
day6.dinner: 1 bowl of pumpkin soup, with a side of sauteed green beans and carrots.
day6.snacks: An orange and a handful of roasted chana.

day7.breakfast: 1 bowl of ragi porridge cooked with milk (or water) and topped with chia seeds.
day7.lunch: 1 bowl of sambar rice (made with brown rice), 1 katori cabbage poriyal (stir-fry), and a papad (roasted).
day7.dinner: 2 multigrain rotis with 1 katori baingan bharta (roasted eggplant, less oil) and a bowl of cucumber raita.
day7.snacks: A bowl of papaya and a cup of green tea.

disclaimer: यह चिकित्सा सलाह नहीं है। कृपया किसी लाइसेंस प्राप्त स्वास्थ्य पेशेवर से परामर्श करें। This is not medical advice.
